items.title: Yanis Varoufakis: Who Needs Marx in 2025?
items.summary: Yanis Varoufakis argues that to break free from technofeudal overlords, we need to adopt the thinking of Karl Marx in 2025.

items.title: Drone Attacks Strike US-Owned Oil Field in Iraq
items.summary: A drone attack targeted a US-owned oil field in Iraq's Kurdistan region, raising security concerns. The use of drones in such attacks poses ethical questions about their impact on global stability and security.

items.title: Russia Claims New Victories After Trump Sets Deadline
items.summary: Russia claims new military victories in Ukraine, using AI-generated voice to communicate. This raises ethical concerns about the use of AI in warfare.

items.summary: ASML Holding NV shares plunged after CEO walked back growth forecast.

items.title: Germany eyes 10% economic output from AI by 2030
items.summary: Germany aims to achieve 10% economic output from AI by 2030, but the strategy doesn't mention the current contribution of AI to the country's economy.

items.title: Nvidia (NVDA): Why Wall Street Remains Bullish on AI Chip Leader
items.summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is receiving bullish ratings from Wall Street for its leadership in AI chips, with KeyBanc reiterating the stock as 'Overweight' on July 14.

items.title: Kettleborough VC launches second fund with Rs 80 crore target
items.summary: Kettleborough VC launches its second fund with a target of Rs 80 crore, having marked its first close at Rs 35 crore. The firm plans to invest in about 10 startups with initial cheques of $300,000–$500,000.

items.title: TSM: Morgan Stanley Says Buy Ahead of Earnings on Strong AI Demand
items.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) is recommended as a buy ahead of earnings due to strong AI demand, with Morgan Stanley adding a catalyst on July 14.
